wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Hall Wallace (1 July 1906 – 1939) was an English professional association footballer who played as a central defender. He made 61 appearances and scored one goal in the Football League Second Division for Burnley.

response: * Thomas Wallace (Irish MP) (1765–1847), Irish politician, UK Member of Parliament
* Thomas Wallace, 1st Baron Wallace (1768–1844), British politician, President of the Board of Control and Vice President of the Board of Trade
* Thomas Wallace (RAF officer) (1916–1944), South African World War II air ace
* Thomas Wallace, drummer of Australian indie rock band Red Riders
